DataElement.preferredName: Rectum Congestive Mucosa Severity Post Radiation Therapy Grade
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric score for the severity of mucosal congestion in the rectum after radiation therapy, using the Vienna Rectoscopy Score (VRS).

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The terminal portion of the gastrointestinal tract, extending from the rectosigmoid junction to the anal canal._Relating to or affected by an abnormal collection of blood or other fluid._The moist tissue that lines some organs and body cavities (such as the nose, mouth, lungs) and makes mucus (a thick, slippery fluid)._Severity; used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The terminal portion of the gastrointestinal tract, extending from the rectosigmoid junction to the anal canal.

Concepts.definition: The terminal portion of the gastrointestinal tract, extending from the rectosigmoid junction to the anal canal.

Property.preferredDefinition: Relating to or affected by an abnormal collection of blood or other fluid.:The moist tissue that lines some organs and body cavities (such as the nose, mouth, lungs) and makes mucus (a thick, slippery fluid).:Severity; used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather.

Concepts.definition: Relating to or affected by an abnormal collection of blood or other fluid.
Used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather; also, strictness.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the outcome or resolution of the patient's adverse events.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Rectum Post Radiation Therapy Congestive Mucosa Grade
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The terminal portion of the gastrointestinal tract, extending from the rectosigmoid junction to the anal canal._Post; occuring after._use PHOTOTHERAPY, LASER THERAPY, or ULTRAVIOLET THERAPY for therapeutic radiation with visible, laser, or ultraviolet light, respectively._Relating to or affected by an abnormal collection of blood or other fluid._The moist, inner lining of some organs and body cavities (such as the nose, mouth, lungs, and stomach). Glands in the mucosa make mucus (a thick, slippery fluid)._A position on a scale of intensity or amount or quality.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The terminal portion of the gastrointestinal tract, extending from the rectosigmoid junction to the anal canal.:Post; occuring after.:use PHOTOTHERAPY, LASER THERAPY, or ULTRAVIOLET THERAPY for therapeutic radiation with visible, laser, or ultraviolet light, respectively.:A position on a scale of intensity or amount or quality.

Concepts.definition: The terminal portion of the gastrointestinal tract, extending from the rectosigmoid junction to the anal canal.
Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.

Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.
A position on a scale of intensity or amount or quality.

DataElement.changeDescription: Curated to support Lombardi Cancer Center clinical trial
